meta_description: Stay connected with Bakersfield Museum of Art's exhibitions, classes, and events.
hours_text:
# Hours & Admission

* * *

## Hours

**Tuesday - Saturday: 10AM-4PM**  
Sunday & Monday: Closed

BMoA is closed on the following event days: February 27, May 17, May 24, May 29, June 26, September 25, October 18, November 13

BMoA is closed on the following holidays: New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Presidents Day, Easter Sunday, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day.

## General Admission

Members: Free  
Adults: $12  
Students: $10  
Seniors (62+): $10  
Children 5 and under: Free

[Click here to become a member or renew your membership](https://bmoa.org/join).

If you are a member of an institution that is part of the [North American Reciprocal Museum Association (NARM)](https://narmassociation.org/members/), present your membership card that includes the gold NARM logo to redeem your membership benefits at BMoA.

  * ###  Directions 

The Bakersfield Museum of Art is located in downtown Bakersfield next to Mill Creek at Central Park. 

The main museum entrance is located on the north side of the building.  
Free Public Parking is available on the north and west side of the building.  
  
Address:  
1930 R St.   
Bakersfield CA, 93301  
  
Visiting by Car:  
  
**From Highway 99**  
Take exit for 24th St. to Highway 178 East about 2 miles  
Turn right on Chester Ave  
Turn left on 21st St., then right on R St.  
The Museum will be on the left-hand side.  
  
**From Highway 58**  
Take Union Ave (204) North abo...

collections_text:
#  [ Bakersfield Museum of Art ](/)

Founded in 1956, the BMOA provides a broad spectrum of visual arts experiences through the exhibition and preservation of fine art, educational programs, community outreach, and special events.

## Opening This Month
